targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  COUNT(DISTINCT card_id) AS num_learned_cards
FROM
  reviews;

SELECT
  ROUND(
    100.0 * (
      1 - SUM((rating = 'fail') :: int) :: decimal / COUNT(*)
    ),
    1
  ) AS avg_retention_pct
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(review_at);

SELECT
  ROUND(SUM(duration_s) :: numeric / (60 * 60), 1) AS hours_spent_reviewing
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  duration_s > 0
  AND $__timeFilter(review_at);

-- select count(*) from reviews

WITH first_seen AS (
  SELECT
    card_id,
    MIN(review_at)::date AS learned_on
  FROM
    reviews
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(review_at)
  GROUP BY
    card_id
)
SELECT
  learned_on AS "time",
  COUNT(*) AS cards_learned
FROM
  first_seen
GROUP BY
  learned_on
ORDER BY
  learned_on;

WITH first_seen AS (
  SELECT
    card_id,
    MIN(review_at) :: date AS learned_on
  FROM
    reviews
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(review_at)
  GROUP BY
    card_id
),
daily AS (
  SELECT
    learned_on AS day,
    COUNT(*) AS new_cards
  FROM
    first_seen
  GROUP BY
    day
)
SELECT
  day AS "time",
  SUM(new_cards) OVER (
    ORDER BY
      day ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
      AND CURRENT ROW
  ) AS cumulative_cards
FROM
  daily
ORDER BY
  day;

SELECT
  date_trunc('day', review_at) AS "time",
  COUNT(*) AS reviews
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(review_at)
GROUP BY
  1
ORDER BY
  1;

WITH latest AS (
  SELECT
    DISTINCT ON (card_id) card_id,
    review_at,
    interval_days
  FROM
    reviews
  ORDER BY
    card_id,
    review_at DESC -- newest review per card
),
schedule AS (
  SELECT
    (review_at + interval '1 day' * interval_days) :: date AS due_date
  FROM
    latest
  WHERE
    interval_days IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT
  due_date AS "time",
  COUNT(*) AS cards_due
FROM
  schedule
WHERE
  due_date BETWEEN current_date
  AND current_date + interval '90 days'
GROUP BY
  due_date
ORDER BY
  due_date;

WITH daily AS (
  SELECT
    review_at :: date AS day,
    COUNT(*) AS total,
    SUM((rating = 'fail') :: int) AS fails
  FROM
    reviews
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(review_at)
  GROUP BY
    day
)
SELECT
  day AS "time",
  ROUND(
    100.0 * (1 - fails :: decimal / NULLIF(total, 0)),
    1
  ) AS retention_pct
FROM
  daily
ORDER BY
  day;

WITH stats AS (
  SELECT
    d.name AS deck,
    COUNT(DISTINCT c.card_id) AS cards,
    COUNT(DISTINCT r.card_id) AS learned,
    COUNT(r.*) AS reviews,
    ROUND(
      100.0 * AVG((r.rating IN ('good', 'easy')) :: int),
      1
    ) AS success_pct,
    ROUND(AVG(r.interval_days), 1) AS avg_interval,
    ROUND(SUM(r.duration_ms) / 60000.0) AS time_min,
    MAX(r.review_at) AS last_review
  FROM
    decks d
    JOIN cards c ON c.deck_id = d.deck_id
    LEFT JOIN reviews r ON r.card_id = c.card_id
  GROUP BY
    d.name
)
SELECT
  *
FROM
  stats
ORDER BY
  reviews DESC;
-- or success_pct, deck, etc.

-- Activity log: creation, learning, and each review
WITH first_learn AS (
  /* earliest review per card = the moment it was first "learned" */
  SELECT
    DISTINCT ON (card_id) card_id,
    review_at,
    rating,
    interval_days
  FROM
    reviews
  ORDER BY
    card_id,
    review_at -- keeps earliest review
)
SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    /* 1. card created ------------------------------------------------------- */
    SELECT
      c.created_at::date AS event_time,
      'created' AS event_type,
      d.name AS deck,
      c.card_id,
      LEFT(c.content, 60) AS snippet,
      NULL :: TEXT AS rating,
      NULL :: INT AS interval_days
    FROM
      cards c
      JOIN decks d USING (deck_id)
    UNION
    ALL
    /* 2. first time card was learned --------------------------------------- */
    SELECT
      fl.review_at::date AS event_time,
      'learned' AS event_type,
      d.name AS deck,
      fl.card_id,
      LEFT(c.content, 60) AS snippet,
      fl.rating,
      fl.interval_days
    FROM
      first_learn fl
      JOIN cards c USING (card_id)
      JOIN decks d ON d.deck_id = c.deck_id
    UNION
    ALL
    /* 3. every subsequent review ------------------------------------------ */
    SELECT
      r.review_at::date AS event_time,
      'reviewed' AS event_type,
      d.name AS deck,
      r.card_id,
      LEFT(c.content, 60) AS snippet,
      r.rating,
      r.interval_days
    FROM
      reviews r
      JOIN cards c USING (card_id)
      JOIN decks d ON d.deck_id = c.deck_id
  ) AS unioned
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(event_time) -- obey dashboard time picker
ORDER BY
  event_time DESC
-- LIMIT
--   1000;
-- cap rows for the panel

/* 1. latest interval per card ------------------------------------------------*/
WITH latest AS (
  SELECT
    DISTINCT ON (card_id) card_id,
    interval_days
  FROM
    reviews
  WHERE
    interval_days IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY
    card_id,
    review_at DESC -- newest review first
),
/* 2. histogram buckets (0–180 in 10-day steps) ------------------------------*/
hist AS (
  SELECT
    width_bucket(interval_days, 0, 180, 18) AS bucket_num,
    -- 18 buckets
    interval_days
  FROM
    latest
)
/* 3. label + count -----------------------------------------------------------*/
SELECT
  (bucket_num - 1) * 10 || '–' || bucket_num * 10 || ' days' AS interval_range,
  COUNT(*) AS cards
FROM
  hist
GROUP BY
  bucket_num
ORDER BY
  bucket_num;

SELECT
  review_at :: date AS "time",
  ROUND(SUM(duration_ms) / 60.0, 2) AS minutes_spent
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  duration_ms IS NOT NULL
  AND $__timeFilter(review_at)
GROUP BY
  1
ORDER BY
  1;

WITH binned AS (
  SELECT
    review_at::date                          AS day,
    width_bucket(duration_ms, 0, 60, 12)      AS bin,          -- 5-s buckets
    duration_ms
  FROM reviews
  WHERE duration_ms IS NOT NULL
    AND duration_ms <= 3600                   -- ✦ exclude >60 min
    AND $__timeFilter(review_at)
)
SELECT
  day                AS "time",              -- X-axis
  (bin - 1) * 5      AS bucket_start,        -- Y-axis (0,5,10…)
  COUNT(*)           AS reviews              -- color
FROM binned
GROUP BY day, bin
ORDER BY day, bin;

SELECT
  (
    SELECT
      COUNT(*)
    FROM
      decks
  ) AS decks,
  (
    SELECT
      COUNT(*)
    FROM
      cards
  ) AS cards,
  (
    SELECT
      COUNT(*)
    FROM
      reviews
  ) AS reviews;

panels.title: Row counts for each table (quick eyeball)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS orphan_cards
FROM
  cards c
  LEFT JOIN decks d ON d.deck_id = c.deck_id
WHERE
  d.deck_id IS NULL;

panels.title: Cards whose deck_id has no matching deck (should be 0)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS orphan_reviews
FROM
  reviews r
  LEFT JOIN cards c ON c.card_id = r.card_id
WHERE
  c.card_id IS NULL;

panels.title: Reviews whose card_id is missing from cards (should be 0)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  COUNT(*)
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  review_at IS NULL;

panels.title: Any reviews with NULL timestamps (should be 0)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  rating,
  COUNT(*)
FROM
  reviews
GROUP BY
  rating
ORDER BY
  2 DESC;

panels.title: Rating value distribution (should list only easy / good / hard / fail)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  COUNT(*)
FROM
  reviews
WHERE
  interval_days IS NOT NULL
  AND interval_days < 0;

panels.title: Reviews with negative or NULL interval_days (sanity of ETL calc)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  r.review_at,
  r.rating,
  c.content,
  d.name AS deck
FROM
  reviews r
  JOIN cards c ON c.card_id = r.card_id
  JOIN decks d ON d.deck_id = c.deck_id
ORDER BY
  r.review_at DESC
LIMIT
  5;

/* total rows vs. distinct (card_id, review_at) pairs */
SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS total_rows,
  COUNT(DISTINCT (card_id, review_at)) AS distinct_rows,
  COUNT(*) - COUNT(DISTINCT (card_id, review_at)) AS duplicates
FROM
  reviews;

SELECT
  card_id,
  review_at,
  COUNT(*) AS dup_cnt
FROM
  reviews
GROUP BY
  card_id,
  review_at
HAVING
  COUNT(*) > 1
ORDER BY
  dup_cnt DESC;
select * from decks
select * from cards ORDER BY created_at desc

select
  *
from
  reviews
ORDER BY
  review_at desc
